Legal_Issue: Whether the CRA's decisions to uphold a level 1 score and refuse reconsideration were arbitrary or procedurally unfair
Application_Facts: Mr. Wloch sought judicial review after being excluded from an IT specialist position due to a level 1 analytical thinking score
Decision_Outcome: Both judicial review applications were dismissed, with no costs awarded
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the scoring decision and exclusion from the selection process
Court_Ruling: The judicial review applications were dismissed as there was no reviewable error or procedural unfairness
Defendant_Behavior: CRA upheld a level 1 score and refused reconsideration
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged arbitrariness and procedural unfairness in the decision-making process
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard for administrative decisions, correctness for pure questions of law
Assessment_Factor: Change in assessment criteria explaining differing scores
Procedural_Issue: Refusal of reconsideration, retroactive application unsupported by process
Review_Standard: Reasonableness, unless involving pure questions of law (correctness)
Application_Basis: Judicial review of administrative decision under CRA processes
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the score and reinstatement into the selection process
Governing_Rule: Administrative decisions must be reasonable and procedurally fair
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Retroactive application was unsupported by process
Cause_Description: Mr. Wloch sought judicial review after being excluded from an IT specialist position due to a level 1 analytical thinking score
Decision_Rationale: No arbitrariness found; change in criteria justified differing scores; no procedural unfairness
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of support for retroactive application
